title.narrative: Providing emergency water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) and health assistance, and a humanitarian hub for aid operations in \Ma’rib governorate

description.narrative:
With support from CERF, IOM will contribute towards improving access and service delivery in conflict affected Ma’rib by operating the humanitarian hub. The humanitarian hub is a critical enabler of the rapid delivery of humanitarian services for internally displaced persons (IDPs), migrants and host communities in Ma’rib. The facility will provide at least 120 office workspaces, 40 accommodation spaces, as well as common services such as security, internet, conference facilities, a clinic, transportation and evacuation capacity, for at least 10 UN Agencies and several other humanitarian partners (INGOs) based on needs.
With support from CERF, and through the hub IOM will also carry out critical WASH and Health activities. Under its WASH programme, IOM will implement first-line WASH interventions to respond to the immediate and lifesaving needs of internally displaced people in Ma’rib. IOM will target 15,500 conflict-affected people with WASH assistance.
CERF funding will also be critical for expanding critical health services (including the provision and procurement of essential medicines and equipment) to cover the widespread needs amongst IDPs and host communities in Ma’rib. IOM will contribute towards reducing avoidable morbidity and mortality through the provision of emergency, primary and secondary health services (including nutrition screenings due to the risk of famine and extreme hunger in Yemen) to vulnerable populations in response to the acute needs. Project activities (which will include providing a minimum package of services (MSP) in two hospitals, one health center, and six mobile teams) will support an estimated 59,663 IDPs, migrants and host community members.
